entry.title: Put Your Hands Together for... [HK]
entry.content:
This is a specialized build, intended for use in the final fight of Raid Wing 4 (Deimos). Often people shy away from doing the handkite role, because it appears complex. This build, however, has a few tricks, and it's a very selfish handkite that doesn't worry about the rest of the squad. They're adults, they can take care of themselves.

It is still a bit more challenging than other builds on this site, but if you're interested in picking up special roles, this is a good one to try.

Gear Alternatives

  • You swap around between Harrier's (least toughness), Minstrel's (more toughness), and Giver's (most toughness) stats to finesse toughness. Aim to have less toughness than your group's tank, and possibly also less than a backup tank.

Consumables

Changing food for handkiting is optional. If you decide to do so, choose any of the following.

Food

 Delicious Rice Ball
 Kralkachocolate Bar

Enhancement

Build

[&DQMvOR0/RioUAQAAXgEAAGABAACKAQAAmAEAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAABVQAA]

Handkiting 101

The goal for a handkite is to stay on the opposite site of the platform as the tank (and group), since the hands spawn at the furthest-away target. The tank will have to move Deimos to avoid oils, so the handkite will move to continue to be on the opposite side.

In an ideal world, you will want to stack 5 hands in the same spot. But we will just do our best. It's better to have a messier cluster of hands than to get downed far from the group. If you're having a hard time with damage, move early.

There are a few things to worry about: Autocasting, Hands, Mind Crush, and Tears. Read on...

Autocasting, Setup

Before the fight, set the following

  • Autocast (Ctrl-Right Click) Utility Goggles
  • Set mech to peaceful to keep it near you.
    Warning: avoid targeting Deimos to allow the mech to stay nearby.
    The mech will go after your target when you press F2/F3

Staying in a kit will also proc Backpack Regenerator. I find it helpful to just stay in Tool Kit most of the time so I don't accidentally use Static Shield (Shield 5).

Hands

Almost immediately, Deimos will start spawning hands. They spawn on the furthest player, 5 spawn at a time (every ~1 second), then there's a short break. Then 5 more, etc. There are several ways to deal with hands:

  1. Facetank hand 1, use Gear Shield (Tool Kit 4) to block 2 hands, sidestep and dodge the last two.
  2. Facetank hand 1, use Elixir S for hands 2-4, dodge hand 5.
    Warning: if a mind crush happens while Elixir S is active, you cannot block it.
  3. Sidestep/dodge plus outheal with Elixir H and Elixir Shell (Mortar Kit 5)

Bonus Healing During Hands

  • Elixir Shell creates a water field, use a leap or blast finisher like Energizing Slam (Mace 2) or Magnetic Inversion (double-press Shield 4) for extra healing and barrier from Chain Reactivity
  • When off cooldown, press Crisis Zone (F2) & Barrier Burst (F3). Because the mech is set to peaceful, it won't do this on it's own, even if you set them to autocast.

* NOTE: always dodge to the side. You will ideally be on the edge of the platform, so a normal dodge backwards will be fatal.

Mind Crush

Starting very quickly (at 90% health), you will see the first Mind Crush. This is the big explosion that does a lot of damage. Save Static Shield (Shield 5) for it. Do not use Shield 5 for anything else.

If you have the ability to listen to audio cues, Saul will call out for people to go to the shield in the center. Handkite should NOT go, but will use Static Shield (Shield 5). After the voice line finishes, wait about 1 second, then leave any kit, and pop the shield.

Additionally, Deimos does the same double handed mace spin animation before mind crush. He'll spin the mace 5 times and then Mind Crush. That can be used for precise timing.

Tears

These are a relatively minor annoyance, but they do increase damage pressure. Walk into nearby tears during the hand "gap time"

Notes

Extremely simple build that does almost all of its damage from range.

Build

[&DQMGNyYvRh8NGwAAJgGGABobAAAQGwAACRuJAQAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAADVQBaADYAAA==]

Rotation

Rifle Mechanist has an extremely simple rotation.

Set all of your Mech skills to auto cast by right clicking them. Your Mech skills should be

Mech Skills:

  1. Explosive Knuckle
  2. Core Reactor Shot
  3. Jade Mortar

and your rotation is to simply

Press:

  1. Blunderbuss (Rifle 2)
  2. Net Shot (Rifle 3)
  3. Overcharged Shot (Rifle 4)
  4. Overclock Signet
  5. Throw Mine

off cooldown.

Crowd Control

You have

CC Skills:

  1. Overcharged Shot (Rifle 4)
  2. Throw Mine
  3. Net Shot (Rifle 3)
  4. Overclock Signet
  5. Force Signet

and they should be used in the listed order. You will notice that most of these skills are the same as skills you want to press in your main damage rotation.

As far as possible, try not to press Force Signet for CC as this will result in a large damage drop.

Advanced Tips

You can use

  1. Jump Shot (Rifle 5)
  2. Shift Signet

as movement skills to get to your objective or to escape from an enemy or mechanic. Jump Shot (Rifle 5) is a leap type skill, while Shift Signet is a Shadowstep (instantaneous teleport), and will thus be the more reliable escape skill.

Shift Signet is also both a condition cleanse and a stun break, and can be used in the direst of situations as a get out of jail free card. However, using it could result in your Mech losing boons, and slightly decreasing your DPS output, hence user discretion is advised.

You can also skill click Jump Shot (Rifle 5) to use it as a damage skill, increasing your DPS output. Skill clicking Jump Shot (Rifle 5) makes you leap in place, reducing it's total cast time, allowing you to increase your DPS as it saves time over using it normally.

If you know when a CC bar is about to come up, it is recommended to save:

  1. Overcharged Shot (Rifle 4)
  2. Throw Mine
  3. Net Shot (Rifle 3)

and use them only when the CC bar is up.

You can also recall your Mech using Recall Mech and resummoning it with Crash Down for even more breakbar damage if required. Do take note that if your Mech has been damaged, you will not be able to resummon it immediately, hence you only want to do this if you are very familiar with the fight, as not having your Mech is a large DPS loss.

entry.title: Chronomechanic [aDPS]
entry.content:
Simple but effective Condition Alacrity build

Gearing

  • Armor: Viper's + Ritualist mix[1] with Runes of the Trapper
  • Trinkets: Viper's
  • Weapons: Viper's Pistol/Pistol with Sigils of Bursting/Earth
  • Relic of the Fractal
  • Food & Utility: Cilantro Flatbread & Toxic Tuning Crystal

Build

[&DQMGJyY5RikNGwAACxuGAA4bAAAQGwAACRuJAQAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAADVQBaAFcAAA==]

Notes

You give Alacrity with:

  1. Barrier Signet
  2. Crisis Zone
  3. Barrier Burst

And you should prioritise these 3 skills above all else. Crisis Zone and Barrier Burst are Mech skills, and can be autocasted. However, due to Mech positioning, you may find yourself dropping Alacrity near the starts of fights, for the 1st and 2nd round of rotations. You should manually cast Crisis Zone and Barrier Burst during your first 2 loops to ensure Alacrity doesn't drop.

Use all skills off cooldown in the following priority order:

  1. Blowtorch (Pistol 4)
  2. Static Shot (Pistol 3)
  3. Poison Dart Volley (Pistol 2)
  4. Overclock Signet

Your CC skills are, in order of priority:

  1. Glue Shot
  2. Crash Down (by unsummoning and summoning Mech)
  3. Static Shot (which makes your Mech do Rocket Punch, but since the cooldown for Rocket Punch is longer that the skill, it might not have CC)

Video

  1. Start by adding Ritualist pieces until you are above 20% boon duration, then fill the remaining slots with Viper's. You can replace Viper's gear with more Ritualist if you find yourself dropping Alacrity. ↩

entry.title: Hyperclocked Mech [aDPS]
entry.content:
Probably the easiest to play Alacrity build

Gearing

  • Berserker's + Diviner's mix [1]
  • Runes of the Scholar
  • Sword, Sigil of Force
  • Shield, Sigil of Air
  • Relic of the Thief
  • Consumables:
    • Cilantro Lime Sous-Vide Steak (Power/Ferocity)
    • Superior Sharpening Stone (Power)

Build

[&DQMGNyYvRioNGyoPJgGGABobowAQGwAACRsSAQAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAADVQBaAFcAAA==]

Notes

You give Alacrity with:

  1. Barrier Signet
  2. Crisis Zone
  3. Barrier Burst

And you should prioritise these 3 skills above all else. Crisis Zone and Barrier Burst are Mech skills, and can be autocasted. However, due to Mech positioning, you may find yourself dropping Alacrity near the starts of fights, for the 1st and 2nd round of rotations. You should manually cast Crisis Zone and Barrier Burst during your first 2 loops to ensure Alacrity doesn't drop.

Press

  1. Refraction Cutter (Sword 2)
  2. Radiant Arc (Sword 3)
  3. Overclock Signet

off cooldown, and that is basically your rotation.

Your auto attack chain reduces the cooldown of Refraction Cutter (Sword 2) and Radiant Arc (Sword 3), allowing you to cast them more often. This lines up pretty well and results in you being able to use Radiant Arc (Sword 3) every other time you use Refraction Cutter (Sword 2).

You have very nice utilities with the Shield. You can bring a Pistol instead for about ~800 more DPS, but I will always recommend the Shield over Pistol.

Magnetic Shield (Shield 4) is a 3s long projectile reflect, and can be pressed twice in quick succession for CC.

Static Shield (Shield 5) is a 2.5s long block, and is basically your panic button. It can also be pressed twice in quick succession for CC.

On top of that, you have Overclock Signet, which is a CC skill even though it is used primarily for damage. Finally, you have Force Signet, which is another CC skill, but you should only use it in the most dire of situations, as using it is a DPS loss.

Video

Build

[&DQMGNyYvOSsqDwAA5RaGAKMAAABXFgAA8BWJAQAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAADWgBXADMAAA==]

Notes

There are a few priority levels to follow, that are layered on top of a simple rotation structure.

Start by preheating to ~100 Heat. You can maintain your heat level by equipping a musical instrument after preheating. The recommended instrument to use is the Unbreakable Choir Bell, which costs less than 1 silver on the TP, but you can use any instrument you like.

Your rotation consists of 2 main parts,

  1. In Forge
  2. Out Forge

and is looped repeatedly.

In Forge rotation:

  1. Corona Burst (Forge 3)
  2. Photon Blitz (Forge 4) + Blade Burst
  3. Corona Burst (Forge 3)
  4. Deactivate Photon Forge

Out Forge rotation:

  1. Radiant Arc (Sword 3)
  2. Refraction Cutter (Sword 2)
  3. Auto attack
  4. Engage Photon Forge @ ~80 Heat

On top of this rotation, there are 2 layers of cooldown based priority button pressing.

Layer 1:

  1. Particle Accelerator
  2. Surprise Shot

Both of these skills have no cast time and will not interrupt any skill casts and should therefore be pressed whenever they are off cooldown.

Layer 2:

  1. Photon Wall (press twice)
  2. Laser Disk
  3. Prime Light Beam

There are 2 parts of the rotation where you should check if these skills are off cooldown, after step 2 during In Forge rotation, and after using Refraction Cutter (Sword 2) once in Out Forge rotation. If the skills are off cooldown during the check, use them.

You have very nice utilities with the Shield. You can bring a Pistol instead for about 1k+ more DPS, but I will always recommend the Shield over Pistol.

Magnetic Shield (Shield 4) is a 3s long projectile reflect, and can be pressed twice in quick succession for CC.

Static Shield (Shield 5) is a 2.5s long block, and is basically your panic button. It can also be pressed twice in quick succession for CC.

A.E.D. is also a good panic button, as it heals you and prevents you from downing to lethal damage for 5 seconds. This is usually used in more advanced group to skip mechanics.

Finally, you have 1 more CC skill, Static Shock. It should be your first option when it comes to CC, followed by Magnetic Shield (Shield 4) and Static Shield (Shield 5).

Video

Outdated damage, but rotation is still the same. This does ~36.5K now.

Rotation

Press off cooldown:

  1. Radiant Arc (Sword 3)
  2. Refraction Cutter (Sword 2)
  3. Throw Mine
  4. Overclock Signet

in order of priority from top to bottom.

Your auto attack chain reduces the cooldown of Refraction Cutter (Sword 2) and Radiant Arc (Sword 3), allowing you to cast them more often. This lines up pretty well and results in you being able to use Radiant Arc (Sword 3) every other time you use Refraction Cutter (Sword 2). Using Throw Mine does NOT cancel your auto attack chain, allowing you to use it off cooldown without delaying the rest of your rotation.

Remember to also set your Mech skills to autocast, allowing you to reduce the APM of the build while losing minimal damage. You can opt to press them manually off cooldown as well, but it is recommended to leave them on autocast regardless.

Mech Skills:

  1. Explosive Knuckle
  2. Core Reactor Shot
  3. Jade Mortar

You can bring a Pistol instead of a Shield for about 1.5k+ more DPS, by using both Pistol skills off cooldown, but I will always recommend the Shield over Pistol as the Shield provides a lot of utility and personal survivability.

Crowd Control

Your CC skills are:

  1. Magnetic Shield (Shield 4)
  2. Static Shield (Shield 5)
  3. Throw Mine
  4. Overclock Signet
  5. Force Signet

However, Throw Mine and Overclock Signet are used as part of your damage rotation, and might not be off cooldown when you need to CC.

Both Magnetic Shield (Shield 4) and Static Shield (Shield 5) have to be pressed twice for CC.

Using Force Signet to CC will result in a DPS loss, and is not recommended unless using it will prevent a wipe.

Magnetic Shield (Shield 4) is also 3s long projectile reflect, while Static Shield (Shield 5) is a 2.5s long block, and can be used as your panic button.

Shift Signet is both a stunbreak and a shadowstep, and can be used to get out of a potential death scenario. However, using Shift Signet will cause your boons to stop copying over to your Mech, resulting in a DPS loss.

Build

[&DQMGNyYvOTsqDwAA5RYAAKMAAABXFgAA8BUAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAADWgBXAFUAAA==]

Rotation

While playing Power Holosmith, you always want to Engage Photon Forge as soon as it is available, as most of your damage is done during Engage Photon Forge. As Engage Photon Forge replaces your weapon skill bar when it is cast, this rotation will consists of 2 different skill priority orders, during Engage Photon Forge and Holoforge Overheated.

Always cast Rifle Turret before the fight begins, and follow the priority of the mode you are currently in. Auto attack if you have no skills to press.

Engage Photon Forge Priority:

  1. Corona Burst (Forge 3)
  2. Photon Blitz (Forge 4)
  3. Photon Wall --> Launch Wall (above 50% heat)
  4. Laser Disk (above 50% heat)
  5. Prime Light Beam (above 50% heat)
  6. Blade Burst (above 50% heat)

Skip Prime Light Beam if it is on cooldown, and note that Photon Wall has be pressed twice to cast Launch Wall. As there is a delay between Photon Wall flipping over to reveal Launch Wall, I personally like to cast it in the order:

  1. Photon Wall
  2. Laser Disk
  3. Launch Wall

Allowing me to queue skill casts and not lose damage uptime.

Ultimately the order which you press the skills are not important, as long as you are able to squeeze in 2 x Corona Burst (Forge 3), 2 x Photon Blitz (Forge 4), 1 x Launch Wall, 1 x Prime Light Beam, and 1 x Blade Burst for every Engage Photon Forge.

Holoforge Overheated Priority:

  1. Refraction Cutter (Sword 2)
  2. Radiant Arc (Sword 3)

During Holoforge Overheated, you are basically just waiting for Engage Photon Forge to come off cooldown, and pressing any high damage weapon skills to upkeep damage as much as possible.

On top of your rotation, you should also

Cast Off Cooldown:

  1. Particle Accelerator
  2. Surprise Shot

Particle Accelerator and Surprise Shot do not have any cast time, and will not interrupt your current skill.

Crowd Control

Your CC skills are:

  1. Static Shock
  2. Magnetic Shield (Shield 4)
  3. Static Shield (Shield 5)

Both Magnetic Shield (Shield 4) and Static Shield (Shield 5) have to be pressed twice for CC, and you can also swap out Rifle Turret for Throw Mine for more CC, and Photon Wall for Personal Battering Ram if you need even more CC.

Magnetic Shield (Shield 4) is also 3s long projectile reflect, while Static Shield (Shield 5) is a 2.5s long block, and can be used as your panic button.

A.E.D. will heal you to 12,280 HP if you take lethal damage, and can also be used as another panic button.
